description_txt: stated on March 23, 2015 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Under Barack Obama, "the average cost of family health care premiums has increased by $4,154."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2015 in a House floor debate:
quote_txt: Lawmakers were paid for their off-season efforts to, for the first time, take the lead in drawing borders for two would-be cities.

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2015 in an appearance on Fox News Sunday:
quote_txt: Says President Ronald Reagan "had a month of job creation of 1 million."

description_txt: stated on April 2, 2015 in a Florida House judiciary committee hearing:
quote_txt: "You know how many children in the history of the United States have died in a fire (at school)? Zero."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2015 in a chain email:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton will receive her "congressional salary until she dies" and the Secret Service pays her mortgage.

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2015 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: Says Indiana Gov. Mike Pence "provides zero state funding for homeless shelters."

description_txt: stated on March 28, 2015 in a Facebook post.:
quote_txt: Virginia House Speaker Bill Howell is "allied to group pushing MIXED SEX BATHROOMS in Stafford Schools."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2015 in a blog.:
quote_txt: "Did you know that the U.S. is one of the very few nations in the world without an official language?"

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says he "paid one dollar for" a sweater at Kohl’s.

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2015 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: An April 7, 2015 referendum would take "the choice of chief justice" of the Wisconsin Supreme Court "away from the people."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2015 in a RedState.com column:
quote_txt: Say Apple’s Tim Cook "will not do business with Indiana."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2015 in a town hall in Austin, Texas:
quote_txt: "In this last election in November, ... 63 percent of the American people chose not to vote, ... 80 percent of young people, (and) 75 percent of low-income workers chose not to vote."

description_txt: stated on March 26, 2015 in a discussion about school uniforms:
quote_txt: A school uniform policy helps with "school safety, helps with truancy."

description_txt: stated on March 19, 2015 in an opinion piece on CNN.com:
quote_txt: "White men account for 69 percent of those arrested for violent crimes."

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2015 in subcommittee hearing:
quote_txt: By allowing brewpubs to sell beer, Georgia could become like Mexico with only a couple of manufacturers controlling all aspects of market.

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2015 in a meme on social media:
quote_txt: Despite raising taxes on the wealthy and hiking the minimum wage, Minnesota "is creating jobs at a record pace, unemployment is at a historic low, median income is skyrocketing, and (the) state has a billion-dollar surplus."

description_txt: stated on February 20, 2015 in a panel on "Real Time with Bill Maher":
quote_txt: "Not a single unarmed white person has been shot by the police" in New York in about 45 years.

description_txt: stated on March 27, 2015 in a news report:
quote_txt: People buy more items during Georgia’s sales-tax holidays, boosting economic activity.

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2015 in an interview with Hugh Hewitt:
quote_txt: "Florida has a law like (Indiana's Religious Freedom Restoration Act)."

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2015 in an interview on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: In the United States, we’ve had "12 years in a row of wages declining."

description_txt: stated on March 25, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: The Affordable Care Act is "a major reason why we’ve seen 50,000 fewer preventable patient deaths in hospitals."

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2015 in a newspaper advertisement:
quote_txt: "White people control almost 90 percent of the nation's wealth."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2015 in a newspaper article:
quote_txt: Georgia has one of the nation’s highest jet fuel taxes.

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2015:
quote_txt: "Today roughly half of born-again Christians aren’t voting. They’re staying home."

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2015 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: "Inflation-adjusted defense spending has declined 21 percent since 2010, and even if we discount the drawdowns in Iraq and Afghanistan, it has still declined by a dangerous 12 percent."

description_txt: stated on March 17, 2015 in a news release.:
quote_txt: "Since President Obama took office in January 2009, the federal government has issued more than 468,500 pages of regulations."

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2015 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Says Barack Obama voted for the "very same language" of Indiana's Religious Freedom Restoration Act when he was in the Illinois state Senate. Sexual orientation "doesn't have anything to do with this law."

description_txt: stated on March 29, 2015 in comments on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: "There's just one piece of legislation that is now law" with Sen. Ted Cruz's "name on it."

description_txt: stated on March 13, 2015 in a television interview:
quote_txt: "Rhode Island has the second highest per enrollee (Medicaid) cost of any state in the country, which is 60 percent higher than the national average."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • March 29, 2015

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2015 in a speech in Concord, N.H.:
quote_txt: "If you took every penny of the 1 percent, including their dog, you wouldn't even begin to balance the budget."
